Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Not using Task.Result in async context." (#8307) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Unclear why the code was written this way originally, but we can get rid of `Task.Result` call here pretty painless.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[A11y][WCAG2.1]Shrink narrow width by a small amount" (#8300) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8282
Narrowing the width at minimum width by a small amount keeps the horizontal scrollbar from appearing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Manage Packages for Solution (all dialogs) would be very nice search box for projects to filter" (#7960) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello.

As we working with solutions with has many projects and heavily uses nugets.

Very nice feature in Nuget Package Manager would be to be bale to filter projects.

In example there is XXX project and I want to install/uninstall nuget for project Y. It is very hard to find that specific project to select and install nuget for it (similar as we have search box for nugets).

Attached image for more details.nuget-filtering.png


_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/471087/manage-packages-for-solution-all-dialogs-would-be.html VSTS ticketId: 802961_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Vidmantas Drasutis on 2/27/2019, 00:31 AM (36 days ago):

This would improve work with nuget`s experience :)

Jane Wu [MSFT] on 2/28/2019, 01:35 AM (35 days ago):

Thank you for taking the time to provide your suggestion. We will do some preliminary checks to make sure we can proceed further. We'll provide an update once the issue has been triaged by the product team.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow package-dependent selection of Projects in Solution PMUI" (#2660) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm using VS2015 Update 2 with NuGet 3.4.3.855. In NuGet UI, despite the fixes in #1896 pressing the spacebar checks only the latest selected project instead of all selected projects. And it gets really annoying to check several dozens of projects among hundreds. Could you please make spacebar check all the selected projects?
And it also would be great if you added a quick way to check all projects that are referencing the selected package (maybe Ctrl + click on the checkbox in the table header).
Thanks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS UI Settings Improvements" (#10222) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Epic tracking improvements to VS Settings as they apply to VS UI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet UI] Search dropdown does not show recent queries in NuGet Packages Manager window" (#10200) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):  VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.x, 5.x

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Open any solution in VS Int Preview 

2. Open in menu Tools -> NuGet Package Manager -> Manage Nuget Packages for Solution 

3. Input search query to Search field

4. Click on Refresh button/any package/empty space to hide Search dropdown by losing focus from Search 

5. Clear Search field

6. Open Search dropdown



Expected: last searched query appear first in dropdown

Actual: last searched query does not appear in dropdown

Note: query appears after selecting it in dropdown on search

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

[Azdo issue](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/620319)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bower Package Management Document errors on VS Reopen" (#10105) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: VS UI
VS version (if appropriate): Version 16.8.0 Preview 3.1
Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: Worked in 15.x, Broken in at least 16.7.4 (not tested earlier)

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
**Note: On Preview VS, I did not have Bower package versions populated in the dropdown. On Experimental VS, I did have versions populated.**

1. Create a bower-incompatible project, such as .NET Standard 2.0, then Open NuGet Package Manager.

2. Find a package that recommends using the Bower Package Manager, eg, jQuery.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/94961820-6d129400-04c3-11eb-8901-95187a320869.png)

3. Select the Bower link to open the Bower Package Manager window.

4. Close Visual Studio.

5. Reopen Visual Studio.

6. An error is shown
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/94962041-cf6b9480-04c3-11eb-9b86-36e821150cd3.png)

## Other suggested things
Relevant: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6623

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure] Tmp file will not disappear in Solution Explorer until reload after installing a package into MyApp who had lock file while the project graph structure is MyApp->MyLib" (#8398) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.3.0.6127
VS Version: Master\29128.08
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-19H1-04-05-2019
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Create a solution with one .NET Core Console App project (called MyApp) and one .NET Core Class Library (called MyLib), make the project graph structure: MyApp -> MyLib.
2. Set property “RestorePackagesWithLockFile” to true in csproj file of MyApp and install a package “Newtonsoft.Json” into MyLib in PM UI.
3. Restore the solution and confirm MyApp\packages.lock.json contains Newtonsoft.Json as a transitive dependency.
4. Install a package “Newtonsoft.Json” into MyApp in PM UI and check the Solution Explorer window.
## Expected
The tmp file will not show in Solution Explorer window.
## Actual
The tmp file will not disappear in Solution Explorer until reload as below screenshot.
![TmpFileNotDisappear](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/62041275-d480e400-b22d-11e9-9002-edb61b289f90.PNG)
## Note
It didn’t repro on Master\29128.08 (the same VS version) +NuGet Client Dev\5.3.0.6118.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS SDK Improvements" (#10221) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Epic tracking improvements to SDK and APIs for VS in general, or the PMUI specifically.
Both internal and external customers are in scope.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Different tabs open by default when in Codespaces" (#10176) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
When connected to Codesapces, the NuGet Package Manager is different in what it offers than when in local.  When choosing Manage Nuget Packages in Codespaces it opens up to the default Installed tab even when an Update is available.  In local it opens to the Update tab if an update is available

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4821/96891403-7d23f080-143d-11eb-92ac-ea0a224cd350.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "VS PMUI Error Handling" (#10219) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Epic tracking refactoring in various areas where NuGet doesn't handle errors, and results in commonly confusing scenarios (eg, VS closing, cryptic error messages, user unaware of an error, excessive telemetry).
